16 please note that left and right hand have their own charts in all sizes read the charts from bottom upwards and from right to left the pattern relies heavily on charts and the chart key page 6 the instructions do not explain how or why something is done links to video tutorials on specific techniques are on page 5 1 cast-on cuff and thumb gusset 2 hand and tip using the kihnu troi cast-on method cast on 42/48/56/64/72 sts measure the length t that you get from 8/10/12/14/16 rounds alternating mc and cc distribute the sts on the needle s and join to work according to the chart ignoring the thumb chart in the work in a round place a bor marker the first stitch after the middle begin decreases when the hand is t cm/inches less than marker is a cc stitch your desired length cuff corrugated ribbing repeat p1 with cc k1 with mc to the if the chart ends before reaching the required length return to the bor repeat this round 15 more times or desired length of cuff row marked with the blue horizontal line and continue from there 2-color lateral braid work the 1st crossed stitch always in mc mark the last full row worked in the chart you can also mark the work the 2nd st the one forming the braid with alternating colors tip decreases in the chart by drawing sloping lines from the sides starting with mc at the end join the braid seamlessly as shown in towards the tip start the tip decreases the linked video tutorial the braid is 2-color but all sts on needles are in mc decrease round work twice k1 ssk
